Package be.helha.api_recettapp.controllers

Class UsersController

java.lang.Object
be.helha.api_recettapp.controllers.UsersController
@RestController @RequestMapping("/api/users") public class UsersController extends Object
REST Controller for managing Users. Provides CRUD endpoints for creating, reading, updating, and deleting Users.

  • Method Details

    • getAllUsers

      @GetMapping public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<List<Users>> getAllUsers()
      Retrieves all users without "Anonymized users" and without admins.
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity containing a list of all users and an HTTP status of 200 (OK)

    • getUserById

      @GetMapping("/{id}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Users> getUserById(@PathVariable Long id)
      Retrieves a user by their ID.
      Parameters:
      id - the ID of the user to retrieve
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity containing the user if found, or a 404 (Not Found) status if the user does not exist

    • createUser

      @PostMapping public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Users> createUser(@RequestBody Users user)
      Creates a new user.
      Parameters:
      user - the user data to create
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity containing the created user and an HTTP status of 200 (OK)

    • updateUser

      @PutMapping("/{id}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Users> updateUser(@PathVariable Long id, @RequestBody Users user)
      Updates an existing user.
      Parameters:
      id - the ID of the user to update
      user - the updated user data
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity containing the updated user and an HTTP status of 200 (OK), or a 404 (Not Found) status if the user does not exist

    • deleteUser

      @DeleteMapping("/{id}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Void> deleteUser(@PathVariable Long id)
      Get the user by its ID to anonymize it, suppress its account in Keycloak and the local DB.
      Parameters:
      id - the ID of the user to delete
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity with an HTTP status of 204 (No Content)

    • getUserByEmail

      @GetMapping("/email/{email}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Users> getUserByEmail(@PathVariable String email)
      Retrieves a user by their email.
      Parameters:
      email - the email of the user to retrieve
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity containing the user if found, or a 404 (Not Found) status if the user does not exist

    • blockUser

      @PostMapping("/{email}/block") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> blockUser(@PathVariable String email)
      Controller method for blocking a user.

      This method handles a POST request to the /{email}/block path. It changes the user's status to "blocked" both in Keycloak and in the database. The user is identified by the email path variable.

      Parameters:
      email - The email of the user to be blocked.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity with a success message indicating the user has been blocked.

    • unblockUser

      @PostMapping("/{email}/unblock") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> unblockUser(@PathVariable String email)
      Controller method for unblocking a user.

      This method handles a POST request to the /{email}/unblock path. It changes the user's status to "unblocked" both in Keycloak and in the database. The user is identified by the email path variable.

      Parameters:
      email - The email of the user to be unblocked.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity with a success message indicating the user has been unblocked.

    • anonymizeUserData

      public void anonymizeUserData(Users user)
      Anonymizes the personal data of a given user.

      This method replaces the user's first name with the string "Anonymized" and sets their email address to a unique anonymized value using a randomly generated UUID. The updated user data is then saved to the database.

      Parameters:
      user - the Users object whose data needs to be anonymized.
